meanings.definition: The act of closing or blocking something
meanings.sent1: The occlusion of the door prevented anyone from entering the room.
meanings.sent2: The occlusion of the drain caused water to overflow in the sink.
meanings.sent3: Trying to open the jammed jar led to an amusing occlusion of the lid.
meanings.sent4: The heavy snowfall resulted in an occlusion of the roads, halting traffic.
meanings.sent5: The occlusion of the gate with a lock kept the garden secure.

meanings.definition: The alignment of the upper and lower teeth when the mouth is closed
meanings.sent1: The dentist checked the occlusion of the patient's teeth for any misalignment.
meanings.sent2: Proper occlusion ensures that chewing food is comfortable and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The comical occlusion of the cartoon character's teeth made kids laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as perfect as an occlusion of puzzle pieces fitting together.
meanings.sent5: The orthodontist adjusted the braces to improve the occlusion of the teeth.

meanings.definition: The process of shutting off blood flow to a particular area of the body
meanings.sent1: A blood clot can cause an occlusion in the blood vessels, leading to health issues.
meanings.sent2: During surgery, the doctors may induce temporary occlusion to control bleeding.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved an unexpected occlusion of blood flow to his hand.
meanings.sent4: The emotional stress resulted in an occlusion of rational thinking in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop in temperature caused an occlusion in the circulation of blood.
